pages.name: Background
pages.description:
This next section will collect information for the court to help them make a decision about guardianship that is in the best interest of the child. It includes questions to collect information about family violence, court proceedings, criminal and child protection history.

Remember, the information you provide will be included in a written document that contains facts that you must swear under oath (usually on a Bible or other religious book) or affirm (non-religious promise) to be true.

elements.name: familyViolenceExists
elements.title: Are you aware of any incidents of family violence that affect the child(ren) you are applying for guardianship of?
elements.description:
`Family violence` includes physical, sexual, and psychological or emotional abuse of a family member. Psychological or emotional abuse includes intimidate, harassment, coercion, threats, financial abuse, stalking, and intentional damage to property.

In the case of a child, it includes witnessing or being exposed to family violence.

elements.name: familyViolenceDesc
elements.title: Please describe the incident(s) of family violence that you are aware.
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear.
